subject: AW: [junit] Problems running JUnit
msgSnippet: Check your classpath: you have to add junit-4.1.jar too your classpath (assuming you use JUnit 4.1). The message indicates, that org.junit.runner.JUnitCore has
messageBody:
Check your classpath: you have to add junit-4.1.jar too your classpath
(assuming you use JUnit 4.1). The message indicates, that
org.junit.runner.JUnitCore has not been found.

And make sure, that your classes (TestX) are also available at classpath.

HTH, Jochen

-----Urspr√ºngliche Nachricht-----
Von: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com]Im Auftrag von
t703093
Gesendet: Freitag, 20. Oktober 2006 14:13
An: junit@yahoogroups.com
Betreff: [junit] Problems running JUnit


Hello,
I have two simple classes:

/////////////////class1

public class X {
public int met (int number) {
int num = number;
if (num > 1)
return num*2;
else{
return 666;
}
}
}

/////////////////class2 (the test class JUnit-class)

public class TestX {
public static void main (String args[]){
X y = new X();
System.out.println(y.met(1));
}
}

and I want to use JUnit to test them, maybe like this:

java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore TestX

But I get this:
NoClassDefFoundError: org.junit.runner.JUnitCore

I guess the problem is that JUnit do not find
org.junit.runner.JUnitCore TestX
?

Anybody have some tips?

BR

Magnus
